descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square of one color filled with another color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same as the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...inverse the colors used in the original shape then add adjacent 4x2 shapes to the outer square on all four sides in the color of the new center square if it had a 2x2 center in the input, or a 3x1 shape on all four sides if the center had a 1x1 shape

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... a two color shape made up of one square surrounded by a square of another color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... create the same shape, but switch the two colors. Use what is now your inside color and create a border around the outside square. This border will be the same width of the middle section of the same color. If a single block is in the center, then border will be 1x3 on both side and 3x1 on top/bottom. If center of shape is a 2x2 square, then border will be 2x4 on both side and 4x2 on top/bottom. Final shape should look like a plus sign.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... a two color shape made up of one square surrounded by a square of another color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... create the same shape, but switch the two colors. Use what is now your inside color and create a border around the outside square. This border will be the same width of the middle section of the same color. If a single block is in the center, then border will be 1x3 on both side and 3x1 on top/bottom. If center of shape is a 2x2 square, then border will be 2x4 on both side and 4x2 on top/bottom. Final shape should look like a plus sign.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square of one color, filled in with another color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same as the input grid size
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...swap the colors used to fill in the square, then add two rows of the inside color running along each side of the outer portion of the square

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a set of blocks that make a square in two separate colors.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should remain the same as the input grid size.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...switch the colors so the are opposite of what they are now, but use the same colors. Add a additional layer of blocks around the square in the outer color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see....a 3x3 square with one color along the outside and a different color on the inside.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stays the same as the input,
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...reverse the colors of the original 3x3 square. Then add the inside color along the outside of the square, in a row of three on each side. Make sure the entire shape is two over from the left edge and two down from the top.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a square with one color and filled with another color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Copy the original input and paste it in the output.  Then inverse the colors, then add the amount of squares that filled the input square to each side, inverse the color. Do not worry about the corners.

annotated_phrases.phrase: a square of one color filled with another color
stays the same as the input grid

inverse the colors used in the original shape then add adjacent 4x2 shapes to the outer square on all four sides in the color of the new center square if it had a 2x2 center in the input, or a 3x1 shape on all four sides if the center had a 1x1 shape
